titles.title: A resolution providing for the consideration of the bill (H. R. 157) to designate September 17, 1987, the bicentennial of the signing of the Constitution of the United States, as "Constitution Day", and to make such day a legal public holiday.

action.text: House Committee on Rules Reported an Original Measure. Report No: 100-125.
Called up by House as Privileged Matter.
Resolution Agreed to in House by Yea-Nay Vote: 405 - 5 (Record Vote No: 283).

bill.summary: 6/4/1987--Introduced. Sets forth the rule for the consideration of H.R. 157 (Constitution Day).
